thread.title: Alto high player suffers seizure during game, is airlifted to hospital
thread.title_full: Alto high school football player suffers seizure during game, is airlifted to hospital - San Antonio Express-News

author: Nick Moyle
title: Alto high player suffers seizure during game, is airlifted to hospital
text:
A player for the Alto Yellowjackets varsity football team was flown to an area hospital Friday night after collapsing on the sidelines, according to a report from KLTV 7 .
The player reportedly told teammates he was dizzy during a huddle. He then collapsed on the sidelines, and a helicopter airlifted the young man to an area hospital.
According to Michael Wesp of MyEastTex.com , it is unclear whether the player was involved in a play before the incident.
His condition is currently unknown.
Reports mention that the student, a junior, suffered from a seizure on the field. CPR was performed on the student before paramedics loaded him into the helicopter.
The game was postponed with 12 seconds left in the first half.
This comes just one week after a Perryton High School football player was placed in a medically-induced coma after he suffered a blow to the head during a game.
